1.text: And Job again took up his parable, and said,

2.text: Oh that I were as in the months of old, As in the days when God watched over me;

3.text: When his lamp shined upon my head, And by his light I walked through darkness;

4.text: As I was in the ripeness of my days, When the friendship of God was upon my tent;

5.text: When the Almighty was yet with me, And my children were about me;

6.text: When my steps were washed with butter, And the rock poured me out streams of oil!

7.text: When I went forth to the gate unto the city, When I prepared my seat in the street,

8.text: The young men saw me and hid themselves, And the aged rose up and stood;

9.text: The princes refrained from talking, And laid their hand on their mouth;

10.text: The voice of the nobels was hushed, And their tongue cleaved to the roof of their mouth.

11.text: For when the ear heard me, then it blessed me; And when the eye saw me, it gave witness unto me:

12.text: Because I delivered the poor that cried, The fatherless also, that had none to help him.

13.text: The blessing of him that was ready to perish came upon me; And I caused the widowâ€™s heart to sing for joy.

14.text: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me: My justice was as a robe and a diadem.

15.text: I was eyes to the blind, And feet was I to the lame.

16.text: I was a father to the needy: And the cause of him that I knew not I searched out.

17.text: And I brake the jaws of the unrighteous, And plucked the prey out of his teeth.

18.text: Then I said, I shall die in my nest, And I shall multiply my days as the sand:

19.text: My root is spread out to the waters, And the dew lieth all night upon my branch;

20.text: My glory is fresh in me, And my bow is renewed in my hand.

21.text: Unto me men gave ear, and waited, And kept silence for my counsel.

22.text: After my words they spake not again; And my speech distilled upon them.

23.text: And they waited for me as for the rain; And they opened their mouth wide as for the latter rain.

24.text: I smiled on them, when they had no confidence; And the light of my countenance they cast not down.

25.text: I chose out their way, and sat as chief, And dwelt as a king in the army, As one that comforteth the mourners.
